data.event: Ice hockey, as we know it, is first played in either Nova Scotia, Windsor, Kingston, Ontario, or Quebec. Origin not clearly defined.
On February 27th, 1877, the first known rules for hockey are published by the Montreal Gazette, a newspaper company.
The Amateur Hockey Association of Canada (AHAC) was the first notable ice hockey league organized in Canada, with four teams in Montreal, one in Ottawa and one in Quebec City.

Governer-General of Canada, Lord Stanley of Preston donates the Dominion of Hockey Challenge Cup (later named Stanley Cup) which is awarded to Canada's top-ranking amateur ice hockey club. First cup awarded to Montreal HC on 1893.

In 1915, the two professional ice hockey organizations, the National Hockey Association (NHA) and the Pacific Coast Hockey Association (PCHA), reached an agreement in which their respective champions would face eachother for the newly renamed Stanley Cup.

event.title: Suspension of NHA and formation of NHL

data.event: After unresolving issues within the organization, executives of three teams susped the NHA and form the NHL.
First five NHL teams announced to play in the first year of NHL. Teams included the Montreal Canadiens, Montreal Wanderers, Ottawa Senators, Toronto Arenas(Maple Leafs), and Quebec Bulldogs.
3rd team of the 'original six' dynasty formed - the Boston Bruins.
4th team of the 'original six' dynasty formed - the Chicago Blackhawks.
5th team of the 'original six' dynasty formed - the Detroit Red Wings.
6th team of the 'original six' dynasty formed - the New York Rangers.
The Montreal Canadiens narrowly escape a relocation to Cleveland, Ohio, before a syndicate of Montreal bought the team. To this day, the Canadiens' team is one of the most notable teams in the NHL.

event.title: One of the Greatest Comebacks in the NHL

data.event: During the 1942 Stanley Cup Finals, The heavily favoured Toronto Maple Leafs were down 3-0 (in a best of 7 series) to the Detroit Red Wings. Toronto rebounded, and won 4 straight games to win the Stanley Cup to become the only team in history to win 4 straight games after trailing 0-3 in the Stanley Cup Finals.
Montreal Canadiens' Maurice Richard scores his 50th goal of the season on the fiftieth - and final - game of the season. Richard was the first of five players in NHL history to achieve this feat.
On March 13th, 1948, Chinese-Canadian Larry Kwong(a.k.a the "China Clipper") plays his first game in the NHL and subsequently breaks the NHL colour-barrier of white players.
Despite only 10% of Canadians owning a television set, the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) began televising games.

Hockey Night in Canada first broadcasted on television, with broadcaster Foster Hewitt calling the action between the Toronto Maple Leafs and Boston Bruins. Hockey Night in Canada quickly became the highest-rated show on Canadian television.
On January 1st, 1958, Willi O'Ree Joined the Bruins as an injury callup. In doing so, becomes the first black player in the NHL.

The end of the Original Six dynasty. The Toronto Maple Leafs beat the Montreal Canadiens, making it the start of the longest Stanley Cup drought in the NHL history, continuing on even today. 1967 was the last year the NHL consisted of only 6 teams.

The NHL undertook a major expansion for the 1967–68 season, adding six new franchises to double the size of the league: California Seals, Los Angeles Kings, Minnesota North Stars, Philadelphia Flyers, Pittsburgh Penguins, and the St. Louis Blues.

On January 18th, 1968 Minnesota North Stars' rookie Bill Masterson died as a result of injuries caused by a forecheck, which landed him on his head. He was rushed to the hospital, and later passed away.
The NHL announces the Buffalo Sabres and the Vancouver Canucks.

event.title: Competition from the World Hockey Association

data.event: The NHL faced competition from the newly formed World Hockey Association in 1972. The WHA lured many skilled players from the NHL by offering grand contracts to them.
The threat of the WHA caused the NHL announce the creation of the New York Islanders and the Atlanta Flames.
The year following the 1972 expansion, the NHL announces two more teams: the Kansas City Scouts and the Washington Capitals.

After 40 years of existence, the NHL approved franchise relocations. The Kansas City Scouts moved to Denver, becoming the Colorado Rockies. The California Golden Seals became the Cleveleand Barons. Just two years later, the Barons merged with the North Stars reducing the NHL to 17 teams.
Following the 1978-1979 season, the WHA folded and six WHA teams joined the NHL:The Edmonton Oilers, Hartford Whalers, Quebec Nordiques and Winnipeg Jets joined the NHL as expansion teams.

The 1979-80 season was the last for the Atlanta Flames. Due to lack of attendance and failure to produce revenue, the Atlanta Flames were sold for $16 million, and relocated north to become the Calgary Flames in 1980-81.

During the 1981-1982 season, Wayne Gretzky, named the best hockey player in the world, reached a record breaking total of 92 goals and 120 assists, combining a sum of 212 points. Four years later, Gretzky beats his own record by earning 215 points.

event.title: Colorado Rockies move to New Jersey

data.event: In the 1982-83 season, the Colorado Rockies were sold for $30 million, and left Denver to become the New Jersey Devils.

event.title: Wayne Gretzky Traded to Los Angeles Kings

data.event: After money issues with the owener of the Oilers, Wayne Gretzky was traded to the Los Angeles Kings.

event.title: NHL expands to three more teams

data.event: During the 1991-1992 season three new teams joined the NHL: San Jose Sharks, Ottawa Senators, Tampa Bay Lightning.
Two teams added in the NHL: Florida Panthers and Mighty Ducks of Anaheim. Minnesota North Stars also change to Dallas Stars.
In 1995, the Quebec Nordiques relocate to Denver to become the Colorado Avalanche.
The Winnipeg Jets relocate to Arizona to become the Phoenix Coyotes.
The Hartfort Whalers relocate to Carolina to become the Carolina Hurricanes.
In 1998, the NHL expands and creates one more team - the Nashville Predators.

event.title: NHL Allows Players Play in Olympics

data.event: To further market their players, the NHL decided to allow NHL players to play in the Olympics, starting in the 1998 Nagano Games in Japan.
In 1999, NHL expands to Atlanta by adding the Atlanta Thrashers.
In 2000, the league added two franchises, boosting the total number to 30. The NHL returned to Minnesota with the Minnesota Wild and added the Columbus Blue Jackets in Columbus, Ohio.
In 2003, the Edmonton Oilers hosted the very first NHL outdoor game against the Montreal Canadiens. MON 4:3 EDM
Due to disagreements between the players and NHL management, A full-year lockout caused the cancellation of the entire 2004-2005 season.

event.title: NHL Removes Tie Games, Adds Shootout

data.event: In the 2005–06 season, the NHL eliminated tie games, as the shootout was introduced to decide all regular season games tied after the five-minute overtime period.

event.title: Alexander Ovechkin and Sidney Crosby join NHL

data.event: In the 2005–06 season, rookies Alexander Ovechkin and Sidney Crosby began their careers. In their first three seasons, they each won both the Art Ross and Hart trophies; Crosby in 2007,[149] and Ovechkin in 2008.

Due to financial troubles, the Phoenix Coyotes file for bakcruptcy in May 2009. The NHL eventually took control over the team, with the hopes of eventually reselling it to a new owner who would be committed to stay in the Phoenix market.
The financially struggling Atlanta Thrashers were sold and then relocated to Manitoba to become the Winnipeg Jets.

event.title: NHL Enters Second Lockout in 21st Century

data.event: he NHL again entered lockout in 2012, cancelling the first 526 games, about 43% of the season, until at least December 30, 2012. Just after 5 am on January 6, 2013, after approximately 16 continuous hours of negotiating, the NHL and the player's union reached a deal on a new agreement to end the lockout.
